result.execSummary:
The defendant Quavosier Montre Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: with 4 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.
First 6 months STRAIGHT TIME, the remainder with Huber and Day Reporting Center.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Provide a DNA sample.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no drugs. Random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Quavosier Montre Harris

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 1 YEAR at the House of Corrections with 4 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.  First 6 months STRAIGHT TIME, the remainder with Huber and Day Reporting Center.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Quavosier Montre Harris in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Quavosier Montre Harris in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea hearing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Quavosier Montre Harris in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 8/13/2015 at 1:30 pm.   Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.
Received and Filed, Defendant's Preliminary Pretrial Motions and Motions in Limine with cover letter.

Defendant Quavosier Montre Harris in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case heard off the record. Parties request an adjourned Scheduling Conference. Case adjourned to branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Quavosier Montre Harris in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Quavosier Montre Harris in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Quavosier Montre Harris in custody.  
Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
